channel.title: Update on The TechGlider
channel.description: Recent content in Update on The TechGlider

item.title: How to Reason about Correctness of Programs Designed for Non-Volatile Memory?
item.description: I recently graduated with a master’s degree in Computer Science from Brown University. My project report that documents the work I did over the last one year is now available on the Brown CS website at https://cs.brown.edu/research/pubs/theses/masters/2017/singhal.kartik.pdf. I am making a copy available here as well: PDF. Abstract Traditional storage stack necessitates a separate data format for the persistence of in-memory data structures, requires additional code for conversion to that data format and wastes a lot of CPU time.

item.title: Welcome to the all new TechGlider!
item.description: The aim of this GitHub site is to disseminate high quality content related to Computer Science, research, programming and general technology. We have a GitHub organization for collaboration, a Twitter account for announcing updates and a Slack channel for discussion. Stay tuned!
